data.title: HESSE
data.text:
BURIAL PLACES OF SOVEREIGNS OF HESSE-DARMSTADT

FROM A TO Z

DARMSTADT (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF ST LOUIS

(Darmstadt, Kirche St. Ludwig, Wilhelminenplatz):

Grand Duchess MATILDA OF BAVARIA (+1862), consort of Grand Duke Louis III

DARMSTADT (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE OLD MAUSOLEUM IN THE ROSENHÃHE PARK (Darmstadt, Park RosenhÃ¶he, Prinz Ludwig Weg, das alte Mausoleum):

01. Grand Duke LOUIS I (+1830)

02. Grand Duchess LOUISE (+1829), consort of Grand Duke Louis I

03. Grand Duke LOUIS II (+1848)

04. Grand Duchess WILHELMINA OF BADEN (+1836), consort of Grand Duke Louis II

05. Grand Duke LOUIS III (+1877)

DARMSTADT (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE NEW MAUSOLEUM IN THE ROSENHÃHE PARK (Darmstadt, Park RosenhÃ¶he, Prinz Ludwig Weg, das neue Mausoleum):

01. Grand Duke LOUIS IV (+1892)

02. Grand Duchess ALICE OF GREAT BRITAIN (+1878), consort of Grand Duke Louis IV

DARMSTADT (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE CEMETERY BY THE NEW MAUSOLEUM IN THE ROSENHÃHE PARK (Darmstadt, Park RosenhÃ¶he, Prinz Ludwig Weg):

01. Grand Duke ERNEST LOUIS (+1937)

02. Grand Duchess ELEANOR OF SOLMS (+1937), consort of Grand Duke Ernest Louis

ST PETERSBURG (RUSSIA)

BURIED IN ST PETER AND PAUL'S CATHEDRAL (Sankt Peterburg, Petropavlovsky sobor, Petropavlovskaya Krepost):

Grand Duchess VICTORIA OF EDINBURGH (+1936), consort of Grand Duke Ernest Louis

LIST OF SOVEREIGNS OF HESSE-DARMSTADT 1790-1918

MARGRAVIATE OF HESSE-DARMSTADT UNTIL 1806:

HOUSE OF BRABANT

1790-1806: LOUIS X

(Ludwig X.; Grand Duke from 1806 as Louis I)

GRAND DUCHY OF HESSE-DARMSTADT 1806-1918:

HOUSE OF BRABANT

1806-1830: LOUIS I (Ludwig I.)

Born in 1753 at Prenzlau.

Father: Landgrave Louis IX of Hesse-Darmstadt. Mother: Caroline von ZweibrÃ¼cken-Birkenfeld.

Married in 1777 in Darmstadt LOUISE of Hesse-Darmstadt (*1761 Darmstadt,+1829 Auerbach).

His issue who reigned:

-LOUIS II (*1777,+1848).

Died in 1830 in Darmstadt.

Buried with his consort Grand Duchess Louise in the Old Mausoleum, RosenhÃ¶he Park, Darmstadt.

1830-1848: LOUIS II (Ludwig II.)

Born in 1777 at Darmstadt.

Father: Grand Duke Louis I of Hesse-Darmstadt. Mother: Grand Duchess Louise og Hesse-Darmstadt.

Married in 1804 in Karlsruhe Princess WILHELMINA of Baden (*1788 Karlsruhe,+1836 Darmstadt).

His issue who reigned:

-LOUIS III (*1806,+1877),

-Maximiliana (*1824,+1880; Empress of Russia).

Died in 1848 in Darmstadt.

Buried with his consort Grand Duchess Wilhelmina of Baden in the Old Mausoleum, RosenhÃ¶he Park, Darmstadt.

1848-1877: LOUIS III (Ludwig III.)

Born in 1806 at Darmstadt.

Father: Grand Duke Louis II of Hesse-Darmstadt. Mother: Grand Duchess Wilhelmina of Baden.

Married in 1833 in Munich Princess MATILDA of Bavaria (*1813 Augsburg,+1862 Darmstadt).

Died in 1877 at Seeheim.

Buried in the Old Mausoleum, RosenhÃ¶he Park, Darmstadt.

His consort Grand Duchess Matilda of Bavaria was buried in the Church of St Louis in Darmstadt.

1877-1892: LOUIS IV (Ludwig IV.)

Born in 1837 at Bessungen.

Father: Prince Karl of Hesse-Darmstadt. Mother: Princess Elisabeth of Prussia.

Married firstly in 1862 in Osborne House, Isle of Wight/England Princess ALICE of Great Britain (*1843 London,+1878 Darmstadt).

Married secondly and morganatically in 1884 in Darmstadt Countess Aleksandra Hutten-Czapska (*1854 Warsaw,+1941 Vevey). Marriage was annuled in 1884.

His issue who reigned:

-ERNEST LOUIS (*1868,+1937; son of Alice),

-Alice (*1872,+1918; Empress of Russia; daughter of Alice).

Died in 1892 in Darmstadt.

Buried with his consort Grand Duchess Alice of Great Britain in the New Mausoleum, RosenhÃ¶he Park, Darmstadt.

1892-1918: ERNEST LOUIS (Ernst Ludwig)

Born in 1868 at Darmstadt.

Father: Grand Duke Louis IV of Hesse-Darmstadt. Mother: Grand Duchess Alice of Great Britain.

Married firstly in 1894 in Coburg Princess VICTORIA of Edinburgh (*1876 Malta,+1936 Amorbach). Divorced in 1901.

Married secondly in 1905 in Darmstadt Princess ELEANOR of Solms (*1871 Lich,+1937 Steene near Ostende, Belgium).

Deposed in 1918.

Died in 1937 in Schloss Wolfsgarten.

Buried with his second consort Grand Duchess Eleanor of Solms in the cemetery near New Mausoleum, RosenhÃ¶he Park, Darmstadt.

His first consort, Grand Duchess Victoria, had been buried firstly in the Ducal Crypt at Coburg. In 1995 she was reburied in St Peter and St Paul's Cathedral at St Petersburg, Russia.

REPUBLIC OF GERMANY SINCE 1918.

BURIAL PLACES OF SOVEREIGNS OF HESSE-KASSEL & WESTPHALIA FROM A TO Z

HANAU (GERMANY)

BURIED IN ST MARY’S CHURCH

(Hanau, Marienkirche, Marienkirchgasse):

Elector WILLIAM II (+1847).

The tomb is located in a sealed vault under the church.

KASSEL (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE CHAPEL OF LÃWENBURG CASTLE

(Kassel, Schlosskirche LÃ¶wenburg, Schlosspark WilhelmshÃ¶he):

Elector WILLIAM I (+1821)

KASSEL (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE OLD CITY CEMETERY

(Kassel, AltstÃ¤dter Friedhof, Lutherplatz):

01. Electress CAROLINE OF DENMARK (+1820), consort of Elector William I.

Buried in the mausoleum.

02. Electress AUGUSTA OF PRUSSIA (+1841), consort of Elector William II.

Buried beside the mausoleum.

03. Elector FREDERICK WILLIAM I (+1875)

Buried beside the mausoleum.

LUDWIGSBURG (GERMANY)

BURIED IN THE PALACE CHURCH

(Ludwigsburg, Schlosskirche, Schlossstr.):

Queen CATHERINE OF WÃRTTEMBERG (+1835), consort of King Jerome Bonaparte of Westphalia.

Her heart was buried in the Church of the Invalides in Paris.

PARIS (FRANCE)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF THE INVALIDES

(Paris, Dome des Invalides, Place Vauban/Avenue de Tourville):

King JEROME BONAPARTE OF WESTPHALIA (+1860)

LIST OF SOVEREIGNS OF HESSE-KASSEL 1785-1866

MARGRAVIATE OF HESSE-KASSEL UNTIL 1803:

HOUSE OF BRABANT

1785-1803: WILLIAM IX

(Wilhelm IX.; Elector from 1803 as William I)

ELECTORATE OF HESSE-KASSEL 1803-1808:

HOUSE OF BRABANT

1803-1806 and 1813-1821: WILLIAM I (Wilhelm I.)

Born in 1743 at Kassel.

Father: Landgrave Frederick II of Hesse-Kassel. Mother: Princess Mary of Great Britain and Hanover.

Married in 1764 in Copenhagen Princess CAROLINE of Denmark (*1747 Copenhagen,+1820 Kassel).

He was never crowned.

His issue who reigned:

-WILLIAM II (*1777,+1847).

Deposed in 1806 and exiled in Denmark. Restored in 1813.

Died in 1821 in Kassel.

Buried in the Chapel of LÃ¶wenburg Castle in Kassel.

His consort Electress Caroline of Denmark was buried in the Mausoleum at the Old Cemetery in Kassel.

1806: HESSE-KASSEL OCCUPIED BY THE FRENCH

1808-1813: HESSE-KASSEL ANNEXED TO THE KINGDOM OF WESTPHALIA

KINGDOM OF WESTPHALIA 1807-1813:

HOUSE OF BONAPARTE

1807-1813: JEROME BONAPARTE (JÃ©rÃ´me Bonaparte)

Born in 1784 in Ajaccio, Corsica.

Father: Carlo Maria Bonaparte. Mother: Maria Letizia nÃ©e Ramolino.

Married firstly in 1803 in Baltimore, Maryland (USA) Elizabeth Patterson (*1785 Baltimore,+1879 Baltimore). Marriage was annulled in 1805.

Married secondly in 1807 in Paris Princess CATHERINE of WÃ¼rttemberg (*1783 St Petersburg,+1835 Lausanne, Switzerland).

Married thirdly in 1840 in Paris Giustina Pecori-Suarez (*1811 Florence,+1903 Florence).

Deposed in 1813 and exiled in WÃ¼rttemberg, Austria and Italy.

From 1848 he lived in France.

Died in 1860 at Villegenis near Paris.

Buried in the Dome des Invalides in Paris.

His first wife Elizabeth Patterson was buried in the Green Mount Cemetery in Baltimore, USA.

His second consort Queen Catherine of WÃ¼rttemberg was buried in the Palace Church at Ludwigsburg, Germany.

ELECTORATE OF HESSE-KASSEL 1813-1866:

HOUSE OF BRABANT

1821-1847: WILLIAM II (Wilhelm II.)

Born in 1777 at Hanau.

Father: Elector William I of Hesse-Kassel. Mother: Electress Caroline of Denmark.

Married in 1797 in Berlin Princess AUGUSTA of Prussia (*1780 Potsdam,+1841 Kassel).

His issue who reigned:

-FREDERICK WILLIAM (*1802,+1875),

-Marie (*1804,+1888; Duchess of Saxe-Meiningen).

Died in 1847 in Frankfurt.

Buried in St Mary's Church at Hanau (no tomb).

His consort Electress Augusta of Prussia was buried at the Old Cemetery in Kassel.

1847-1866: FREDERICK WILLIAM (Friedrich Wilhelm)

Born in 1802 at Philippsruhe near Hanau.

Father: Elector William II of Hesse-Kassel. Mother: Electress Augusta of Prussia.

Married morganatically in 1831 in Rellinghausen Gertrud Falkenstein-Lehmann (*1803 Bonn,+1882 Prague).

Deposed by the Prussians in 1866 and exiled in Austria-Hungary (Bohemia).

Died in 1875 in Prague.

Buried at the Old Cemetery in Kassel.

1866: HESSE-KASSEL OCCUPIED AND ANNEXED BY PRUSSIA
